tour.listViewContent: Type your task name and Press the ENTER key to create a task. Feel free to experiment with adding a description, uploading a file, commenting, selecting dependencies, and creating a requirements checklist.
tour.detailViewContent: Here you can see your tasks visualized in a tree diagram. Clicking a task hides or shows the tasks underneath it. Double clicking allows you to edit the title. Hover over one and click the little blue icons to change how the sub-tasks are displayed. Clicking the plus icon on the left, right, top, or bottom adds a new task! Try it.
tour.ganttViewContent: This is your standard GANTT view for project scheduling, handy for setting start and end dates, dependencies, and task durations.
tour.agileContent: Agile view allows you to create as many kanban style boards as you wish. Some people like to create one for each team member, or you could even create one for each sprint, your call. Create lists (or columns) which represent the Agile Status for each task. Tasks can only belong to one agile board, for the sake of everyone's sanity. You can add tasks here that were created in other views or add completely new ones.
tour.raciContent: Visualize who should be taking care of what. Resource names can be free text not corresponding to PlanHammer users so that you can just write in your stakeholder groups or other non-registered team members or users. Users assigned to a task are automatically set as Responsible and the user who created the task is automatically set as Accountable. RACI view exports as a spreadsheet for the old school.
tour.riskContent: Here you can update your project's risk register by adding risk entries to keep track of those known unknowns.
tour.freeMonthContent: Invite people to use PlanHammer via email, Google +, or LinkedIn. If they click through your message and signup you'll get your next month at PlanHammer for free automagically.
tour.accountContent: Here is your info. Adding your first and last name now would be nice so that it will show up on comments and assignment labels instead of your email address.
tour.paymentsContent: Here's how you will give us money. Add your details and the card comes to life. Try it, it's sorta neat. We do not store credit card data, it zips right over to our payments processor (Stripe). Your data input is secured by SSL (Green Bar in URL). You will be charged monthly based on the number of unique users that are collaborating on your projects with you on your billing due date. So if you wanted to remove everyone and then add them again, you could do that if you really wanted to.
tour.collaboratorsContent: This is how we keep track of how many people you have invited to your projects. If you want to cut down your bill, here's where the heads gotta roll.
tour.goodTalkContent: Well that's all folks. Remember to click the info button in the left sidebar for detailed video overviews of the current screen you are on when you click it.
tour.settingsContent: Here you can rename the project, set the project timezone and invite or manage collaborators.

activityFeed.uploadTaskFile: __user__ uploaded a file to the task "__task__".
activityFeed.deleteTaskFile: __user__ deleted a file from the task "__task__".
activityFeed.deleteDependency: __user__ deleted a dependency from the task "__task__".
activityFeed.attachRisk: __user__ associated the risk "__risk__" to the task "__task__".
activityFeed.detachRisk: __user__ removed the risk "__risk__" from the task "__task__".
activityFeed.addFileToRisk: __user__ attached a file to the risk "__risk__".
activityFeed.deleteFileFromRisk: __user__ removed a file from the risk "__risk__".
activityFeed.addList: __user__ added the list "__list__" in the "__board__" agile board.
activityFeed.updateList: __user__ updated the list "__list__" in the "__board__" agile board.
activityFeed.updateRaciRole: __user__ updated the RACI role of "__resource__" on "__task__".
